I've set max-hops to 2 in my TooManyHopsDecideRule in an effort to 
start f=
rom small sample crawls and build up from there, in large part 
based on re=
search saying that 80%-90% of visits to web sites occur at 
hops < 5.  

Af=
ter running the crawl for about 1 day, though, I'm surprised to find 
that =
the speed of the crawld does not seem to have increased as much 
as I would=
 have expected.  I'm not downloading nearly the volume of 
data into my ARC=
 files as I was with max-hops=3D20.  However, the 
crawler will spend a gre=
at deal of time idling, not downloading any 
pages.  It will often go a min=
ute or more without downloading 
anything.

It appears to me it must still =
be evaluating the same number of 
overall URIs as it was before, but just r=
ejecting the vast majority of 
them.  Is this accurate?  I guess I expected=
 it would avoid evaluating 
the same number of URIs because it could reject=
 so many right away 
that are only reachable beyond a certain number of hop=
s.  Given that 
decide rules only come into play after the crawler has reac=
hed a given 
URI, though, I suspect this is not the case.

Any way I might =
be able to tweak things so setting the hops that low 
makes the crawler not=
 even consider a huge set of URIs?

Sorry if I'm missing something obvious =
here.
